description: Consider the sequence of 4-tuples {0,a,b,c} (c>=a+b; a,b,c>0)) which have the smallest integer 'c' required to reach {k,k,k,k} in n steps under map {r,s,t,u}->{|r-s|,|s-t|,|t-u|,|u-r|}. This sequence gives the third term 'b' of these quadruples.
formula: a(n)= 2*Trib(2*q) if r=0; Trib(2*q-1)+Trib(2*q+1) if r=1; Trib(2*q)+Trib(2*q+1) if r=2 where q=[(n-1)/3], r=n-1 (mod 3) and Trib denotes the tribonacci sequence (A000073) with Trib(-1)=1. G.f.: (-x^7+2*x^6-2*x^5+2*x^4-2*x^3-x)/(x^9+x^6+3*x^3-1). Recurrence: a(n)=3*a(n-3)+a(n-6)+a(n-9), n >= 10.
crossrefs: A034803, A045794 (or A065678) give the terms 'a' and 'c' respectively.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Better description, more terms, formula, etc. from Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)hotmail.com), Jun 24 2001
